attributes.action: Stop Banks and Building Societies raising interest rates.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: When the Bank of England cut interest rates to 0.5% last year, the Banks & Building Societies did not pass on the full benefit of the cut to thier customers. Most suspended cuts at around the 2% - 3% mark. We petition the government to prevent them from imediately increasing thier rates as soon as the Bank of England increase the base rate from 0.5%. They should not be allowed to increase rates until they reach the level at which they stopped passing on the benefit of the cuts to thier customers.
